actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs.

official_title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to provide that certain benefits to which employees of the United States stationed in Alaska, Hawaii, Puerto Rico, or a territory or possession of the United States are entitled may be terminated under certain conditions.

summary.text: Terminates specified travel and transportation benefits, leave benefits, and environmental allowances provided for a Federal employee stationed in Alaska, Hawaii, Puerto Rico, or a territory or possession of the United States after the employee has performed five years of continuous civilian service in the same area, unless: (1) the head of the employee's agency determines that continuation of such benefits is warranted and in the interests of the United States; or (2) the post of duty is determined to be a hardship station.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to provide that certain benefits to which employees of the United States stationed in Alaska, Hawaii, Puerto Rico, or a territory or possession of the United States are entitled may be terminated under certain conditions.
